entry.title: .each()

argument.name: function
argument.desc: A function to execute for each matched element.

entry.desc: Iterate over a jQuery object, executing a function for each matched element.

longdesc.p: The .each() method is designed to make DOM looping constructs concise and less error-prone. When called it iterates over the DOM elements that are part of the jQuery object. Each time the callback runs, it is passed the current loop iteration, beginning from 0. More importantly, the callback is fired in the context of the current DOM element, so the keyword this refers to the element.

You can stop the loop from within the callback function by returning false.
